subject: AI & Agents
title: Context Windows and Long-Context Models
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Context Windows and Long-Context Models.

hook.text: GPT-3 saw 4K tokens. GPT-4 Turbo sees 128K. That's an entire book at once.

buildup.text: The context window is the maximum number of tokens the model can process in one call.

discovery.text: Longer contexts let models summarize documents, compare files, and reason over large inputs.

twist.text: Attention cost grows quadratically with context length. 128K tokens is very expensive to serve.

climax.text: Techniques like sliding window, sparse attention, and RoPE scaling extend context efficiently.

punchline.text: Bigger windows, bigger understanding, bigger bills.

quiz.question: Why are long context windows expensive?
options: Attention cost grows quadratically with context length
